description: Product management interview focusing on strategy and execution
base_questions: How do you prioritize features for a product roadmap?
Describe a product you launched successfully from concept to market.
How do you handle a stakeholder who strongly disagrees with your product vision?
What metrics do you track to measure product success?
How do you identify and validate user needs?
Explain a time you had to say 'no' to a feature request and why.
How do you collaborate with engineering and design teams?
What is your favorite product and why?
How do you handle a product failure or missed target?
Describe your process for conducting competitive analysis and market research.
sample_good_answers: I use the RICE scoring model (Reach, Impact, Confidence, Effort) to objectively prioritize features against our quarterly OKRs. I also consider strategic alignment and technical dependencies.

I conducted 20 user interviews and analyzed our funnel data to identify that the checkout process had a 40% drop-off rate. I worked with UX to simplify it from 5 steps to 2, which increased conversion by 18%.

I believe in early and frequent communication with engineering during the discovery phase to ensure technical feasibility is considered. I also participate in sprint planning to answer questions and unblock the team.
sample_bad_answers: I just go with my gut feeling on what features to build next.
I usually just tell the engineers what to build and let them figure it out.
I don't really track metrics, I prefer to talk to users and get qualitative feedback only.
